item.title: Maui's Wildfires Rage On, Challenging Firefighting Efforts
item.description: Unveiling the Mythical Fury: Maui’s Wildfires Rage On, Challenging Firefighting Efforts Maui, August 12, 2023 — The picturesque paradise of Maui is facing an unprecedented natural catastrophe as wildfires continue to rage across the island, leaving authorities and residents grappling with a unique set of challenges. Unlike typical wildfire scenarios, the flames have taken on an almost mythic quality, prompting locals to dub them “Pele’s Breath,” in reference to the Hawaiian goddess of fire and volcanoes.

item.title: Disaster dealy wildfire acroos Maui
item.description: Headlines Six people have been killed in wildfires in Maui. Broadband internet outage across Hawaii. Violent wind across Hawaii from Maui burning. 150,000 gallons of water spray dropped yet to stop burning but no outcome yet. US Miltery top on the race to deploy firefighters to save Maui and Big Islands. Copast guards from US is saving life to do water rescue. People run into the ocean to save life. Fires is continuing and not under control.
